page.title: 09LOCAL NEWSPAPERS IN FLITWICK
page.content: There are seven local newspapers. Four are 'free sheets' delivered to every house each week advertising events and services as well as goods for sale. These are as much a guide to future events as a record of last week's news. The longer established newspapers have a greater news content and are often looked to for pictures and stories of friends or acquaintances. Many people will know someone in at least one of the papers each week and most people will have appeared in a photograph or news item at some time. The only daily newspaper is published from Luton some ten miles south of Flitwick. It is read by some because it gives news of the area in which they work and by others because they can remain in touch with the area they lived in before moving to Flitwick.
